data.title: N.J.’s higher education institution leaders showcase why their school is top choice for students
data.meta_description: Representatives of some of the state's colleges, universities and trade schools discuss why their institution is a winning choice for today’s students.
data.text:
With nearly 70% of all U.S. students currently pursuing higher education, the desire to find a school that represents the best fit for each student has never been greater. And with their own unique personality, academic curriculums, social and extracurricular activities, and student experience, New Jersey’s dozens of public and private higher education institutions are outstanding contenders.

Following, representatives of some of the Garden State’s most prominent colleges, universities and trade schools discuss the characteristics that make their institution a winning choice for today’s students and how they best prepare students for the future.

Matthew Whelan, EdD, President, Caldwell University (Caldwell)

“Caldwell is a great option for students because it has been named a ‘Best Value School for Regional Universities in the North’ by U.S. News & World Report and is close to home for many of them. With degrees ranging from the bachelors to the doctorate, we have one of the lowest tuition costs for private colleges in New Jersey, and 98% of our recent graduates are employed, enrolled in graduate school or have joined a service program. Caldwell’s education is designed to guide students to develop critical thinking skills and embrace diverse cultures and inspire them to contribute to a just society. We integrate our core values of respect, integrity, community and excellence into our curriculum and strive to ensure that they inform who we are and everything we do. Throughout the pandemic, we’ve seen the enormous value of our academic programs, as many of our graduates have been front-line responders and alumni of such Bachelor of Science programs of ours as nursing, health care administration and public health. Come see us and experience the Caldwell way.”

Kathryn A. Foster, President, The College of New Jersey (Ewing)

“TCNJ delivers an exceptionally high-quality education in a welcoming and supportive environment — an experience that many New Jersey families seek from expensive, out-of-state colleges yet can find much closer to home and at a fraction of the price at TCNJ. We offer students a wide range of degree options, from professional fields such as business, nursing, education and engineering to the full menu of arts and sciences. TCNJ focuses on finishing in four years and has a proven track record of success in that regard, annually ranking among the top public institutions in the country for four-year graduation rates.”

Thomas M. Eastwick, President, Eastwick College (Hackensack and other locations)

“At Eastwick College, our programs prepare students for practical, in-demand careers through specialized hands-on training that mirrors what they’ll face on the job. For example, students in our cardiovascular sonography program learn how to create internal images of the heart and vascular system in ultrasound scan lab classrooms using equipment similar to that used by many local hospitals and medical facilities. We also offer a number of accelerated programs, which allow students to start their careers in as little as six months. It’s clear that ‘essential’ jobs such as nurses, surgical assistants, plumber apprentices and IT technicians will play a major role in the job market moving forward and will remain in steady demand even during economic downturns because no matter what happens, we still need people to fix our plumbing if a pipe bursts or restore the network so that a Zoom meeting can start. Those are exactly the types of careers we prepare students for at Eastwick College.”

Lamont Repollet, EdD, President of Kean University (Union)

“Nationally recognized for social mobility, Kean University helps students succeed no matter their ethnicity, race, sexual orientation or socioeconomic status. At Kean, our students not only receive a world-class education but also robust support services and career preparation to keep them on track for graduation and career success. In addition to being the most affordable, comprehensive public university in New Jersey, Kean is designated a ‘Hispanic-Serving Institution’ and is also one of the most diverse universities in the nation, which makes for an inclusive college experience for students as they prepare to enter the global economy. The university’s modern classrooms, labs and residence halls along with more than 160 student clubs/organizations and 14 NCAA Division III teams provide great spaces to learn and grow. Kean’s 50 undergraduate majors and 60-plus graduate options prepare students for in-demand jobs and jobs of the future, and our far-reaching internship program and research opportunities provide invaluable real-world experience. Our students are resilient, smart and driven, and Kean is committed to supporting their growth as students, professionals, thought leaders and innovators in our global society.”

Susan A. Cole, President, Montclair State University (Montclair)

“As a nationally ranked public research university serving more than 21,000 students and 130,000 alumni, Montclair State University is empowering students, faculty and staff to take their personal, professional and academic lives to new heights. Our students reflect the communities that comprise New Jersey, one of the most diverse states in the country; more than half of Montclair State’s students come from minority groups that have historically been underrepresented in higher education. The university has been designated a ‘Hispanic-Serving Institution’ and is committed to ensuring access to affordable, quality higher education for all students. It has also been recognized as one of America’s ‘Best Value Colleges’ by Forbes magazine and is among the top 25 institutions in the nation for the social mobility of its graduates. With world-class facilities, highly regarded faculty and more than 300 academic programs at all levels, our scholarly community prepares students for the world and the workforce while helping elevate New Jersey through jobs, innovations and services.”

George P. Blount, PhD, President/CAO, National Career Institute (Jersey City and East Orange)

“Conveniently located in Hudson and Essex counties, NCI offers in-demand programs that prepare students for competitive entry into the workforce. Among those are allied health programs providing skills currently in high demand, including Clinical Medical Assistant with Externship, Medical Billing and Coding, and Patient Care Technician with Externship. At the same time, NCI’s Electrical Assistant and HVAC, Plumber Assistant and Building Maintenance, and General Construction trade programs prepare graduates for pursuit of such additional and beneficial certifications as the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA 608) Universal Certification and Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA 30) Certification. Offering extensive hands-on instruction in small-class environments conducive to learning, NCI prepares students for the future by utilizing a combination of theory and laboratory instruction led by instructors with years of firsthand knowledge and experience in their field. A year from now, you’ll wish you’d started at NCI today.”

Joel S. Bloom, President, New Jersey Institute of Technology (Newark)

“NJIT has a proven track record of student success. Our university is ranked No. 1 in the entire nation for the upward economic mobility of students from the lowest quintile of family income to the highest quintiles and is also among the top 2% of universities in the country for alumni earnings. NJIT is additionally ranked among the top 100 national universities by U.S. News & World Report and is rated an ‘R1’ research university by the Carnegie Classification, which places us among the nation’s 131 most elite research universities. Today, every major company and industry is shaped by technological evolution; our global, national and regional economies are driven by technological developments, enhancements and breakthroughs that result in new products, capabilities or enhancements in efficiency. As a preeminent polytechnic university, NJIT prepares graduates for the positions that are in greatest demand while also providing them with the skills needed to assume positions of leadership that will shape the future of the industries in which they work.”

Christopher J. Molloy, PhD, Chancellor, Rutgers University-New Brunswick

“Ranked among the top three public research universities in the Northeast, Rutgers-New Brunswick is known for excellence in education and world-changing research. Working closely with Rutgers Biomedical and Health Sciences, which trains the next generation of health professionals, we educate some of the brightest young minds who go on to advance society. Our services and innovations span the gamut from global forecasting for hurricanes to fighting the spread of COVID-19 through development of the world’s first saliva test. As a premier higher education institution and member of the Big Ten, Rutgers-New Brunswick is committed to ensuring that our students develop the critical-thinking, problem-solving and collaborative skills needed to be successful in solving the complex and challenging problems of our times, while as a state land-grant university, our mission is to keep the cost of education affordable so that all New Jersey residents have an opportunity to pursue a college degree. Our robust Career Exploration and Success Center provides students with connections that help them jump-start their careers; four-year graduation rates overall and for black students at Rutgers-New Brunswick are 20% and 40% higher than the national average, respectively, and, on average, 85% of our graduates are employed or enrolled in graduate school within six months of graduation.”

Joseph E. Nyre, PhD, President, Seton Hall University (South Orange, Newark, Clifton/Nutley)
